Name: Coptic textile
Description: Segment from the corner of a plain background linen textile with two edges partly preserved, and decorated with a thick red margin and two thin dark blue bands toward one edge, and to the centre a polychrome circular panel with a stylised floral motif. This is from a group of Coptic textiles acquired at the Faiyum, forming an instructive group for regional comparison beside the fine set from Akhmim in Upper Egypt, acquired in 1888.
